title: Short-Intensive Clinical Virtual Problem-Based Learning (VPBL) Course: Enhancing Clinical Language and Communication Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic medical terminology and physiological concepts, ability to interpret fundamental medical texts, and foundational grammar/vocabulary knowledge for clinical report writing
context.additional_context: A non-degree short-term program for working professionals, focusing on solving real medical cases in a virtual environment. Particular emphasis is placed on improving clinical language skills, including patient record analysis, diagnostic report writing, and accurate use of medical terminology. Learners refine critical thinking and communication skills through symptom observation, evidence collection, and conclusion-drawing processes.

learning_goals: Enhance clinical situation analysis and specialized medical terminology skills through virtual scenario-based problem-solving, with a focus on patient symptom observation and evidence-based conclusion drawing.

Using collaboration tools like Slack or Microsoft Teams, learners communicate in real-time with 3 peers, draft symptom descriptions and diagnostic reports for 2 patient cases within 1 hour, and finalize reports incorporating peer feedback. Medical text comprehension and specialized vocabulary usage are emphasized.

Identify learning gaps based on formative assessments and propose improvement plans for medical text interpretation and specialized vocabulary use, focusing on enhancing grammatical accuracy and clarity of expression in diagnostic report writing.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
